content.raw:
Attempt of summarizing the talk with @scpeters and @caguero IRL:

* We should be better communicating both internally and externally:
    * When a (pre-)release branch has been created off of default
    * Until when that will be considered a pre-release
    * When the release has been officially made
* Pre-release branches do not necessarily mean they are in code freeze and there may be breaking changes
* Whoever is making the pre-releases should make sure there aren't any changes on default which should be ported to the pre-release branch before pulling the trigger
* Once an official release has been made (and clearly communicated to the whole community!) we should consider making it a policy to always bump the default branch's version
    * This requires creating new homebrew formulas

  • We should be better communicating both internally and externally:
    • When a (pre-)release branch has been created off of default

  • Whoever is making the pre-releases should make sure there aren't any changes on default which should be ported to the pre-release branch before pulling the trigger
  • Once an official release has been made (and clearly communicated to the whole community!) we should consider making it a policy to always bump the default branch's version
    • This requires creating new homebrew formulas
